ZEC แตก $300 support ในขณะที่ bears กระชับการครอบงำ – $200 ถัดไปสำหรับ Zcash IF…

ZEC breaks $300 support as bears tighten grip – $200 next for Zcash IF…

11h ago//Muriuki Lazaro
general
AI

Summary

TH

Zcash (ZEC) ยังคงอยู่ภายใต้แรงกดดันขายที่หนักหน่วงหลังจากตกผ่านระดับการสนับสนุนสำคัญที่ $300 และปัจจุบันซื้อขายอยู่ใกล้ระดับ $245 การไม่สามารถยืนเหนือ $300 ทำให้ระดับนี้กลายเป็นแนวต้าน และผู้ขายกำลังกดดันราคาลงสู่โซนราคา $240–$244 หากแนวรับระยะสั้นนี้ไม่สามารถยืนได้ ราคามีความเสี่ยงที่จะดิ่งลงไปที่ระดับจิตวิทยา $200–$210 ซึ่งถูกกดดันเพิ่มเติมจากความไม่แน่นอนด้านกฎระเบียบของ privacy coin ในกรอบเวลาสั้น ZEC มีการปรับตัวลดลงอย่างรุนแรงแต่พบแรงซื้อเข้ามาใกล้โซน $238–$240 โดยมีรูปแบบแท่งเทียน Hammer บ่งชี้ว่ามีผู้ซื้อเข้ามาช่วยเหลือ แม้ว่าราคาจะมีเสถียรภาพและสร้างจุดต่ำสูงขึ้น แต่แนวโน้มหลักยังคงเป็นลบ การฟื้นตัวที่ยั่งยืนจำเป็นต้องยึดครองแนวต้านในช่วง $260–$280 กลับคืนมาได้ มิฉะนั้นสินทรัพย์นี้มีโอกาสที่จะดิ่งลงต่อเนื่องไปยัง $200

EN

Zcash (ZEC) remains under significant bearish pressure after breaking below the crucial $300 support level, currently trading near $245. The failure to hold $300 has turned it into a resistance barrier, with sellers pushing the price toward the $240–$244 support zone. If this near-term support fails, the price risks sliding further to the psychological $200–$210 level, exacerbated by regulatory headwinds facing the privacy coin sector. On the lower timeframes, ZEC completed a sharp capitulation move but found demand near the $238–$240 zone, marked by a hammer candlestick suggesting buyer intervention. While the price has stabilized and formed higher lows, the broader trend remains negative. A sustainable recovery would require reclaiming the $260–$280 resistance range; otherwise, the asset is vulnerable to continued declines toward $200.

Key Points

  • ZEC broke below $300 support, now facing resistance at that level and trading near $245.
  • Critical near-term support is at $240–$244; a breach could trigger a slide to the $200–$210 demand zone.
  • Short-term charts show buyers defending the $240 level with a hammer candlestick, hinting at a potential relief rally.
  • Privacy coin headwinds, including regulatory scrutiny, continue to weigh on sentiment.
  • Sustained recovery requires reclaiming the $260–$280 resistance zone.

Article

Journalist Posted: February 6, 2026 ZEC remained under strong bearish pressure as price continued printing lower highs and lower lows, with trendline resistance capping recovery attempts. At press time, Zcash traded near $245 after breaking below the $300 support, which has now flipped into resistance. As momentum weakened, sellers pushed the price toward the $240–$244 support zone, marking the near-term downside target. Source: TradingView If this area fails, downside risk could expand toward the $200–$210 psychological zone, where deeper demand may emerge. Meanwhile, resistance sits between $260 and $280, with $300 acting as the key structural barrier for any sustained recovery. Although MACD compression and stretched price conditions hinted at oversold levels, any rebound required stronger volume and macro support. Without that backing, relief rallies were likely to fade into renewed selling pressure. Beyond price action, privacy-coin headwinds remained visible. Regulatory scrutiny and competition from newer privacy solutions continued to weigh on sentiment. Bears retained control below $300, while a loss of $240 exposed ZEC to a deeper slide toward $200. Demand rebuilds above $240 following capitulation In the lower timeframe, Zcash [ZEC] completed a sharp capitulation move, declining from around $270 into the $238–$240 demand zone, where downside momentum began to ease. This zone reflected prior accumulation, largely created by reactive buyers and short-term traders who previously absorbed sell pressure at these levels. As price revisits it, the same participant cohort steps in again, reinforcing the floor. Source: TradingView At the lows, buyers responded firmly, printing a hammer candle with a long lower wick that rejected prices below $240. That rejection shifted short-term order flow, as price stabilized instead of extending losses. Two consecutive green candles then formed a higher low near $244–$246, strengthening early recovery signals. Meanwhile, RSI hovered near oversold territory, reflecting stretched downside conditions rather than fresh bearish expansion. The indicator’s modest uptick suggested that selling momentum was fading. Price held above the $240 psychological level, pointing to dip demand strength as forced selling subsided. Rebounds may now build toward the $260–$280 resistance zone, while a breakdown below $240 could accelerate losses toward $210. While the broader trend remained bearish, this reaction zone highlighted downside compression as positioning gradually reset. Final Thoughts Below $300, ZEC remains in a clear bearish structure with $240 acting as the key downside line before $200–$210 comes into play. Buyers are defending the $240 zone, but any recovery is capped unless the price reclaims the $260–$280 resistance range.
